column4: Would it matter if I installed the desktop version of ubuntu on a netbook?
I do not believe there is a separate netbook edition anymore
you are supposed to usee the desktop one
Part of the issue is that I just installed ubuntu on my netbook and.. I noticed it wasn't even noticing my wireless device.
you may need to install restricted drivers
However I plugged it to a lan connection and its pulling updates right now
Where would I find the addictional drivers program.
no idea how to navigate unity. I can tell you the command line way.
Sure
gksu jockey-gtk
do that after updating package lists
another thing I did was lspci | grep Network
And my wifi card STILL wont show up even after the update
didn't show up in additional drivers? What about lshw -c network
ifconfig -a?

Ever since I took it to geeksquad/bestbuy to have the monitor fixed, they shipped it off somewhere and replaced the monitor but took my hard drive out and replace it and gave me a system with no operating system and my wifi worked then(though I had windows then) but even after those two commands that you told me that I just entered I only see my ethernet hardware
maybe it is a bios setting to enable wifi? That happens some times
Do you think they took my wireless card out and forgot to put it back in? Is that possible? (If it is I am going to surely **** them up) XD
Checking
Checked. Nothing in the BIOS at all indicated anything much about the wireless except sometype of "Wake-on LAN"
no idea than
